data.title: Autocomplete only works on every other key press with multiple cursors on same line
data.body:
If the primary cursor is not the only cursor on it's line, autocomplete suggestions are only available on every other key press.
![vscode_autocomplete_singleline](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6246237/14247922/390e26ea-fa7a-11e5-82a4-6f9a60ee403f.gif)

Manually opening the suggestions works, but causes the next key press to not trigger autocomplete. If secondary cursors are on a different line than the primary cursor autocomplete works as expected. Number and order of secondary cursors doesn't seem to matter.

Expected: Autocomplete triggers after every key press.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Default settings, no extensions. Tested with .ts and .php files.
2. Create multiple cursors on one line and type anything that would open the autocomplete suggestion box.
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11, 0.10.13-insider
- OS Version: Windows 7

data.title: i18n: wrong german translation for "Warning" label
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.13-insiders

Steps to Reproduce:
1. trigger a warning dialog, e.g. start up vscode with git <2.0.0 installed

![vscode_warn](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8385202/14247298/864b6aba-fa6d-11e5-82a8-2415c1bbc02e.png)

"Warning" gets translated to "Warnen" (verb) in german version, but it should be "Warnung" (noun) in this case.

data.title: Intellisense triggering after typing comma, space inside a string literal
Linter error flag is showing up while changing language mode to CSS and then back to original.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. launch app and open any HTML file. 
2. Verify file type displayed correctly in the task bar.
3. Click on file extension from task bar and change it to CSS.
4. Verify proper error and warning flag should be raised on editor.
5. Now click on auto detect and verify it should change to HTML and all the errors should go away.

Actual: Editor detected html file but error flag for CSS remain as it is.
Expected: once auto detect covert from CSS to HTML then editor should identify appropriate linter.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14242993/c95cbab8-fa07-11e5-8c64-2ec9effa934c.png)

data.title: Make order of ConfigurationDoneRequest and LaunchRequest deterministic

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently the order of ConfigurationDoneRequest and LaunchRequest is not deterministic, that means it is possible that a ConfigurationDoneRequest comes after the LaunchRequest. This is problematic because only a ConfigurationDoneRequest indicates that all breakpoints have been registered and that a LaunchRequest is able to hit all those breakpoints. If the ConfigurationDoneRequest comes after the  LaunchRequest some breakpoints might be missed.

There are two scenarios to consider:
1. An InitializedEvent is sent early (after the InitializeRequest has been processed but before the LaunchRequest). This is used in mono-debug and mock-debug where breakpoints can be registered before launching the debuggee.
2. An InitializedEvent is sent late (while the LaunchRequest is being processed). This is used in node-debug where node.js has to be launched first before breakpoints can be registered).

From the first case it looks like the frontend could always wait with calling LaunchRequest until ConfigurationDoneRequest has been ended. But this would not work with the second case.

/cc @isidorn

data.title: Feature request: Please remember last x git commit messages where x is configurable or some arbitrary number (w/ option to paste any of these messages in the git message box)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.13-insider
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

I was doing a commit with a big commit message, after the commit, it turns out I left out a few un-staged files, so I went and undid the last commit and started to re-commit with all files staged.

The problem was that in the process, I lost the previous commit message as I was ready to commit this one and VSCode didn't remember my last message, nor did it offer an option to paste in the last commit message. 

Please implement this capability.

data.title: Tasks.json environment variable expansion case sensitive

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.13 alpha
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add an variable to your tasks.json ex. ${env.PATH}
        "command": "echo",
   "isShellCommand": true,
   "args": ["${env.PATH}"],
2. Run the task.
   This will expand correctly on Linux and OS X but not Windows since the expansion is case sensitive and PATH on Windows is "Path".
   Env Var expansion shouldn't be case sensitive so that the same task can run on all platform.
   This bug was requested by @dbaeumer in vscode-docs issue https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/issues/247

data.title: Allow file operations on entries in opened editors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Launch app and add any file or open any folder.
2. Verify rename operation inside explorer using F2 key.

Actual: There is no way to rename explorer contents using any keyboard shortcut or with mouse double click.

Scenario:
I tried to add a html file but forgot to add extension. As there is no way to rename the file or change the extension inside explorer window so I added other file with the same name and .html extension. That took me to perform couple of actions along with copy and paste the file contents. If we have a option to rename the file or change the file extension by pressing F2 then it would be more convenient and save multiple user's actions.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14235846/b996acf4-f9be-11e5-9352-4dfdeb46a0e3.png)

data.title: Allow manually specifying promise timeouts
Manage encoding files by extension of filenames
data.body:
Hello "VS Code" team,
- I do a language extension for "VS Code", 
  (https://github.com/FrancisFaure/vfp_tmlanguage_generator)
  (Visual FoxPro)
- I search a setting for the "codepage" on file extensions files (.PRG) on "Windows 1252" and not "UTF-8" by default
- I try (without succes to add "files.encoding": "windows1252" in "package.json"
- "VS Code" website say  : 
  users can change all codepage "globally" or codepage on "workspace"
  (https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/codebasics#_file-encoding-support) 

But in the same directory we can have files in utf8 and others in "Western" (Windows 1252) codepage

I tried to add "files.encoding": "windows1252" in my language pack (package.json) without success..

I googled without solutions

sorry for my bad english

With best regards 
Francis

data.title: Code completion with C/C++ extension
data.body:
Hi,
I've been testing the new C/C++ extension, however I am running into some problems with code completion suggestions.

Here is an example with C/C++ extension installed, forcing suggestions using cmd+space.
It results in perpetual "Loading..." pop up:
![screen shot 2016-04-03 at 2 38 39 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6202456/14234198/bff5f8d4-f9aa-11e5-8469-06e0e4058893.png)

With the extension uninstalled, the suggestions show up immediately
![screen shot 2016-04-03 at 2 47 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6202456/14234217/30154b60-f9ab-11e5-8bcc-c887b76714c8.png)

The features like go to symbol and go to definition are working properly with the extension installed,
however it seems to hinder the code completion.
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: El Captain (OS X 10.11.4 )

data.title: Issue with autoformat, rest spread and insider version
April Iteration Plan
data.body:
While watching the community feedback on 1.0, we have already started to work on the next update. We will continue to ship monthly. This plan captures what we work on during April and will ship early May.

We arrived at the following themes for April:
- Ramp up the work on the next major version.
- Do some explorations.
- Reduce engineering debt in vscode and the primary extensions which the team maintains (vscode-eslint, vscode-jshint, vscode-tslint, vscode-jscs).

For more information about our development process please refer to the development process [page](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process).

The [April Test Plan](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+label%3Atestplan-item+milestone%3A%22April+2016%22) is in progress.
### Schedule

The goal is to make the April update available by the following dates.

End game dates (we end an iteration with an [endgame](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process#end-game))
##### Monday, Apr 25
- [x] Code freeze at end of day
##### Tuesday, Apr 26
- [x] Test build done
- [x] Testing
- [x] Push to `insider` channel
##### Wednesday, Apr 27
- [x] Testing
- [x] Fixing
- [x] Run OSS tool
##### Thursday, Apr 28
- [x] Fixing
- [x] Verification
##### Friday, Apr 29
- [x] Fixing
- [x] Smoketest
  - [x] Windows @bpasero 
  - [x] OS X @jrieken 
  - [x] Linux @aeschli
- [x] All release notes updated 
  - [x] @aeschli
  - [x] @alexandrudima 
  - [x] @bpasero 
  - [x] @jrieken 
  - [x] @joaomoreno 
  - [x] @isidorn 
  - [x] @egamma 
- [x] Acknowledge pull requests in release notes: @bpasero 
- [x] All issues verified
- [x] Satellite modules ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] vscode @bpasero 
  - [x] yo generator @aeschli 
  - [x] vsce @joaomoreno 
  - [x] Debug adapter @weinand 
##### Monday, May 2
- [x] Push to `insider` channel
##### Monday, May 9
- [x] Release `stable` channel
### Plan Items

| Mark | Description |
| --- | --- |
| :runner: | work in progress |
| :hand: | task is blocked |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration |
#### Debt Items

This section lists items to reduce our engineering debt:
- [ ]  Community: Support Pull Requests for the Wiki @Tyriar 
  #### Feedback

Issues to address feedback from the community:
- [ ] UI: Start implementing support for tabs #224 @bpasero 
- [ ] UI: 
  #4650 @bpasero
- [x] UI: Add command to reopen last closed editor #3989 @Tyriar 
  - Test #5586
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] I18N: Command palette match support for non-ascii characters #4691 @bpasero
- [x] Provide an option to stop scrolling revealing active file in explorer #3062 @bpasero
  - Test: #5329 
- [x] Emmet: support to disable expansion on TAB #5756 @egamma
- [x] I18N: Support to filter the Command Palette by English name #4679 @bpasero
  - Test: #5764 
- [x] API: Add support for internal links in previewHtml #3676 @jrieken 
  - Test: #5747
- [x] API: Provide API to open a new folder #58  @bpasero
- [x] Git: Commit in the command palette #4471 @joaomoreno 
  - Test: #5766 
- [x] Linux: Support running vscode with sudo permissions #3068 @tyriar
  - Test #5062
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] Linux: Include CLI in Linux zip archive and support custom install locations #4426 @tyriar
  - Test #4985
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] Linux: Notify user when a new update is available @joaomoreno
  - Test: #5757 
- [x] Debug - Data inspection support for ES6 objects (sets, maps, generators) Microsoft/vscode-node-debug#51,  Microsoft/vscode-node-debug#41 @weinand
  - Test #4949
  - [x] Release notes
- Address feedback received on primary extensions
  - [x] eslint @dbaeumer 
  - Test: #5654 
  - [x] tslint @egamma  
  - Test: #5758 
  - [x] jshint @kieferrm 
  - Test: #5759 
  - [x] jscs: @chrisdias 
#### Engineering

This section lists several engineering/development items that the team identified:
- [x] Debug - Paging support for stack frames #4792 @weinand @isidorn
  - Test #4819
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] Debug - Data inspection of large objects for Node v4.x and v5.x
  - Test: #4951 
    Microsoft/vscode-node-debug#11 @weinand 
  - Test #4951
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] Debug - Data inspection support for large strings and objects with getters Microsoft/vscode-node-debug#14 @weinand 
  - Tests #4952, #4957
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] Implement version 2 of the language service protocol addressing feedback from version 1 @dbaeumer 
- [x] Adopt - Electron 0.37.x #4199  @bpasero 
#### Initial investigations/explorations
-  :runner: UI - Improve extension installation UI #637 @joaomoreno
-  :runner: UI - Add an integrated terminal #143 @Tyriar 
- [x] Debug -  C++ debug scenario to enable additional debug views (e.g. memory view) @isidorn
- [x] Debug - Support skipping code when stepping #4798 @weinand
  - Test #4954
  - [x] Release notes
- [x] API - Use web view for html preview part #2414 @jrieken 
  - Test: #5748 
#### Deferred from April
#### Deferred to May
- [ ] :runner: Debug - Support for dynamically generated source maps #4492 @weinand 
  - recent change of SystemJS broke dynamic source map support; deferred to May release
  - Test #4953
  - [ ] Release notes
## Bugs

This section includes bug queries for the vscode related repositories:
- [vscode](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Aupstream+milestone%3A%22April+2016%22)

For more information about our development process please refer to the development process [page](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process).

data.title: VS Code does not create ui window if xflux program runs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11, 0.10.13-insider
- OS Version: Ubuntu 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. install and run xflux (quite popular program) from https://justgetflux.com/
2. try to run vs code

AR: code process starts, but does not starts process with type=renderer and ui window does not appear
also appears one more process of xflux app

if you kill all xflux processes and rerun vs code, again xflux starts. If you kill it (xflux), vs code window appears

data.title: Can't switch between Working Files section and folder section in File Explorer panel using the keyboard
data.body:
When activating the File Explorer panel by hitting `<CTRL>+<SHIFT>+<E>`, either the "Working Files" section or the project folder section is active.

However, I don't seem to be able to scroll beyond any of both lists using the arrow keys on my keyboard, which is rather annoying.
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10/64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit `<CTRL>+<SHIFT>+<E>` on the keyboard so the File Explorer panel gets activated
2. From the list which currently (and apparently randomly) has received focus, hit any of the `ARROW UP`/`ARROW DOWN` keys until you reach the junction point between both file lists.

=> You cannot scroll across the two file lists in File Explorer panel using the keyboard:

![vscfileexplorer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9283914/14231679/d5a917ec-f98c-11e5-8439-4b2f1676f77a.gif)

data.title: Difficult to read intellisense popup box

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
**Visual Studio Code** (version 0.10.11 on Windows 10586.164):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9047283/14229163/73d5eb04-f92c-11e5-9963-49df1a64e733.png)

Source code, documentation, signature, all look almost the same. The following issues make it difficult to read:
- Same background as the underlying text view
- Same font and color as source code for documentation and signature, even line heights matches
- Difficult to see where does documentations ends and where does the actual signature begins
- Signature is incorrectly syntax highlighted: only the const keyword is highlighted, while any or any other type is not
- Wraps the signature into multiple lines which makes it more difficult to read, even if I still have a bunch of space horizontally on my screen
- **+1** Links in the documentation text look like highlighted keywords. First thought was it is a bug: even the text is colorized, then seen that they are links.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9047283/14229256/6bacae60-f92f-11e5-8fe5-b5b8eaafe5a0.png)

For reference, **Visual Studio**:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9047283/14229203/a5f05be6-f92d-11e5-8228-ee48ac4569fd.png)
- Different background and typography, it does not feel like it is embedded into the editor (the other one looks like an area in the editor with a border, there is no depth)
- Documentation and signature is separated visually
- Signature colorized correctly (keywords, types, identifiers)
- Signature is not wrapped into multiple lines

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hover on anything

data.title: Support opening files through URL handling

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VSCode Version: 0.10.11
OS Version: Windows 10 

Details:
Please provide a URL handler for accessing vscode from external applications.
For example :
`vscode://open?url=file://path/to/file`
`vscode://new?text=text_that_will_be_in_file&type=js`

This would be very useful for lets say browser extensions etc....
